posts._title: Jacques Tati – L’école des facteurs AKA The School for Postmen (1947)
posts.title: L’école des facteurs
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:School for Postmen (French: L’École des facteurs) is a short film directed by Jacques Tati in 1947. Tati plays a French postman adamant to prove he can be just as fast as American postmen at delivering mail. The film includes several sight gags that involve his bicycle. He replicated most of the action here in …

posts.title: Jaffa, the Orange’s Clockwork
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:A journey from the harbor town of Jaffa to the Jaffa orange, a fruit through which the Israeli filmmaker examines the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. posts.title: The Slow Business of Going
posts.excerpt: A mysterious woman travels the world with a rocking chair, interacting with the people she meets. Petra Going is a migrant cyborg, an agent of the Global Nomad Project: an international “Experience Data Agency” which sends hundreds of “receivers” like her to wander the globe and record a succession of random encounters.
